goalDescription: Find the sum of natural numbers from 1 to 10.

blocks.domainModelQuestion: What is the goal of the block of code (line 4-line 5)?
blocks.logicalStep: It declares variables to represent a sum and a limit up to which we want to add numbers to compute their `sum.
blocks.programModelQuestion: Can you explain in detail how the goal of the current block of code (line 4-line 5) is actually implemented?
blocks.logicalStepDetail: A variable sum of integer type is declared to hold the sum of natural numbers. Also, another variable n of integer type is declared to represent the limit up to which we want to add numbers to find the sum.

questions.question: Why is variable sum declared and what is its type?
questions.answer: A variable sum of integer type is declared to hold the sum of natural numbers.

questions.question: What does the variable n represent and what is its type?
questions.answer: Variable n represents the limit up to which we want to add numbers to find their sum.

blocks.domainModelQuestion: What is the goal of the block of code (line 7-line 10)?
blocks.logicalStep: It finds the sum of natural numbers from 1 to 10 and prints it.
blocks.programModelQuestion: Can you explain in detail how the goal of the current block of code (line 7-line 10) is actually implemented?
blocks.logicalStepDetail: The value of the variable sum is first initialized to 0. Then, a for loop is used to iterate over all integers from 1 to 10. At each iteration, the current integer i is added to the sum. When the for loop ends, the value of the sum is 55. Finally, the program prints "sum = 55".

questions.question: What value is the variable sum initialized to?
questions.answer: The value of sum is initialized to 0.

questions.question: What integer values is the for loop iterating over?
questions.answer: The for loop is used to iterate over all integers from 1 to 10.

questions.question: In each iteration, what happens to variable sum?
questions.answer: In each iteration, the value of the current integer in the loop variable i is added to the sum.

questions.question: What is the value of sum when the for loop completes execution?
questions.answer: When the for loop ends, the value of the sum is 55.

statements.statementComment: The for loop below iterates over all numbers from 1 to n. Because n is 10, the loop iterates over all numbers from 1 to 10. The for loop stops executing when i reach 11.

questions.question: What numbers does the for loop below iterate over?
questions.answer: The for loop below iterates over all numbers from 1 to n.

questions.question: Given that n is 10, in this particular case, what numbers does the for loop iterate over?
questions.answer: Because n is 10, the loop iterates over all numbers from 1 to 10.

questions.question: When does the for loop stop executing?
questions.answer: The for loop stops executing when i reach 11.
